predictions.text: China NBS Manufacturing PMI for September 2025 will print between 49.5 and 50.5 in the release on 2025-09-30.
predictions.verification_criteria: Use the official National Bureau of Statistics (NBS) release for September 2025 Manufacturing PMI headline index. Prediction is correct if the reported PMI is ≥49.5 and ≤50.5.
monitoring_signals: Credit impulse and property sales data
predictions.rationale: Recent weak China data and property drag suggest manufacturing near the contraction/expansion threshold.

predictions.text: Tokyo CPI ‘core-core’ (excluding fresh food and energy) year-over-year for September 2025 will be between 1.6% and 1.9% in the release by 2025-10-04.
predictions.verification_criteria: Use Statistics Bureau of Japan Tokyo area CPI for September 2025: ‘All items less fresh food and energy’ YoY. Correct if value is ≥1.6% and ≤1.9%.
predictions.rationale: Base effects and easing goods prices offset services firmness, keeping core-core subdued.

predictions.text: U.S. unemployment rate for September 2025 will be between 4.0% and 4.2%, per BLS Employment Situation on 2025-10-03.
predictions.verification_criteria: Use BLS Employment Situation news release Table A-1 (seasonally adjusted unemployment rate) for September 2025. Correct if rate is ≥4.0% and ≤4.2%.
monitoring_signals: NFIB hiring plans and Indeed hiring trends
predictions.rationale: Claims have drifted higher and labor demand cooled; unemployment likely stays near 4.1%.

predictions.text: U.S. CPI-U headline year-over-year for September 2025 will be between 2.7% and 3.1%, as reported by BLS on 2025-10-10.
predictions.verification_criteria: Use BLS CPI-U all items YoY for September 2025 from the CPI news release. Correct if value is ≥2.7% and ≤3.1%.
monitoring_signals: Used car auction prices (Manheim) and airfare
predictions.rationale: Energy base effects and steady core keep headline near 3%, despite tariff-related pressures.

predictions.text: U.S. CPI-U core (all items less food and energy) year-over-year for September 2025 will be between 3.0% and 3.3%, as reported by BLS on 2025-10-10.
predictions.verification_criteria: Use BLS CPI-U core YoY for September 2025 from the CPI news release. Correct if value is ≥3.0% and ≤3.3%.
monitoring_signals: Rent and owners’ equivalent rent trends
predictions.rationale: Shelter disinflation is gradual; services ex-shelter moderates, keeping core near low-3%.

predictions.text: NYMEX WTI front-month crude futures will settle at or above $93.00 per barrel on at least one trading day by 2025-11-30.
predictions.verification_criteria: Use CME Group official daily settlement for the prompt WTI (CL) futures contract. Correct if any settlement on or before 2025-11-30 is ≥$93.00.
monitoring_signals: OECD crude inventories and U.S. Cushing stocks
U.S. shale production growth and rig counts
predictions.rationale: Tight inventories and geopolitical risks provide upside tails to crude before winter.

predictions.text: The LBMA Gold Price PM will fix at or above $2,600 per troy ounce on at least one trading day by 2025-11-30.
predictions.verification_criteria: Use the LBMA Gold Price PM auction result. Correct if any PM fix published on or before 2025-11-30 is ≥$2,600/oz.
monitoring_signals: ETF gold flows and central bank purchases
predictions.rationale: Falling real yields and geopolitical risks support a test of new highs into year-end.

predictions.text: USD/JPY (Yahoo Finance: JPY=X) will close at or above 154.00 on at least one trading day by 2025-11-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Use Yahoo Finance JPY=X daily adjusted close in UTC. Correct if any close on or before 2025-11-30 is ≥154.00.
monitoring_signals: BoJ policy guidance and YCC balance-sheet changes
Risk sentiment and carry trade positioning
predictions.rationale: Wide rate differentials and carry demand keep upside pressure on USD/JPY absent forceful intervention.

predictions.text: Solana (SOL-USD) will trade at or above $190 on at least one day by 2025-10-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Use a major consolidated source (CoinMarketCap or CoinGecko) for SOL-USD intraday highs in UTC. Correct if any recorded high on or before 2025-10-31 is ≥$190.
monitoring_signals: On-chain activity (TPS, fees) and DeFi TVL on Solana
U.S. macro risk sentiment and liquidity
predictions.rationale: Crypto beta improving with broader risk-on; payments news and ecosystem growth support upside tails.

predictions.text: By 2025-10-31, OFAC will announce at least one sanctions designation under its Russia-related program via public press release or sanctions list update.
predictions.verification_criteria: Correct if the U.S. Treasury (OFAC) publishes any Russia-related sanctions designation by 2025-10-31 on its website press releases or SDN list updates.
monitoring_signals: White House and State Department statements on Russia
OFAC press room and SDN list update cadence
Defense procurement and evasion network exposures
predictions.rationale: Regular cadence of Russia-related designations is likely to continue into October.

predictions.text: U.S. JOLTS Job Openings for August 2025 will be at or above 8.5 million in the BLS release on 2025-10-01.
predictions.verification_criteria: Use BLS JOLTS news release for August 2025 total job openings level (seasonally adjusted). Correct if openings ≥ 8.5 million.
monitoring_signals: Conference Board Help Wanted Online index
NFIB job openings hard to fill
predictions.rationale: Openings have declined but remain elevated; a floor near mid-8 millions is plausible.

predictions.text: The U.S. 10-Year Treasury yield (FRED: DGS10) will close at or below 3.65% on at least one trading day by 2025-11-30.
predictions.verification_criteria: Use FRED series DGS10 daily close. Correct if any observation on or before 2025-11-30 is ≤3.65%.
monitoring_signals: Term premium estimates and Treasury supply
predictions.rationale: A Fed easing pivot and growth wobble could pull 10-year yields toward mid-3s at times.
